intro: Indigofera rigescens var. inermis, commonly known as the slender indigo or velvet bean, is a climbing legume native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and trifoliate leaves with elliptical leaflets. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are followed by elongated pods containing edible seeds. It is valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it useful in agricultural systems. The seeds are also used as a protein-rich food source in some regions.
